precontext: The siblings spent their summer exploring the beach. They often searched for interesting things that washed ashore. One day, they stumbled upon something curious hidden in the sand.
sentence: They discovered an old log near the shore that revealed a lot about the past.
ending: This is because it had so many rings on it, showing it was more than 200 years old.
meanings_considered: a segment of the trunk of a tree when stripped of branches
a written record of events on a voyage (of a ship or plane)
explanation:
• The precontext of searching for items washed ashore and finding something hidden in the sand strongly suggests a natural object like a tree trunk, making meaning 1 (a segment of a tree) plausible.  
• The mention of "rings on it" and its age (more than 200 years) directly supports the interpretation of a tree log, as tree rings are a well-known feature of logs.  
• Meaning 2 (a ship's log) is implausible because there is no mention of a vessel, voyage, or maritime activity, and the ending does not reference navigation or records.
